metadata.title: CVE-2022-4128 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A NULL pointer dereference issue was discovered in the Linux kernel in theMPTCP protocol when traversing the subflow list at disconnect time. A localuser could use this flaw to potentially crash the system causing a denialof service.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
